import pandas as pd 
import numpy as np 

df = pd.read_csv("/home/bit/Desktop/ps/ml2/backend/data/datasets/house-prices/train.csv")
print(df.isnull().sum())
df.dropna(inplace = True)
print(df.isnull().sum())

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np 
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error, r2_score

df=pd.read_csv("/home/bit/Desktop/ps/ml2/backend/data/datasets/house-prices/train.csv")
X=df.drop(columns=["SalePrice", "Id"])
y=df["SalePrice"]

X=pd.get_dummies(X.fillna(0))

model=LinearRegression()
model.fit(X, y)

y_pred=model.predict(X)

rmse=np.sqrt(mean_squared_error(y, y_pred))
r2=r2_score(y, y_pred)

print("Root Mean Squared Error:", rmse)
print("R-squared:", r2)

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
df=pd.read_csv("/home/bit/Desktop/ps/ml2/backend/data/datasets/house-prices/train.csv")
x=df.drop(columns=["SalePrice","Id"])
y=df["SalePrice"]

x=pd.get_dummies(x.fillna(0))

m=LinearRegression().fit(x,y)
test=pd.read_csv("/home/bit/Desktop/ps/ml2/backend/data/datasets/house-prices/test.csv")
t_id=test["Id"]

X_test = pd.get_dummies(test.drop(columns=["Id"]).fillna(0))
X_test = X_test.reindex(columns=X.columns, fill_value=0)


preds = model.predict(X_test)


pd.DataFrame({"Id": t_id, "SalePrice": preds}).to_csv("submission.csv", index=False)
